bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mr. REED:H.R. 2994.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:Article I, Section 8, which states ``The Congress shallhave Power To lay and collect Taxes,''[Page H5400]

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.title: Homeowners Debt Relief Extension Act of 2014

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

item.title: To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to make permanent the exclusion from gross income of discharges of qualified principal residence indebtedness.

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.
Read twice and referred to the Committee on Finance.

item.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

summary.text: Mortgage Forgiveness Tax Relief Act of 2013 - Amends the Internal Revenue Code to extend through 2014 the exclusion from gross income of income attributable to the discharge of indebtedness on a principal residence.

bill.title: Mortgage Forgiveness Tax Relief Act of 2013

item.title: Mortgage Forgiveness Tax Relief Act of 2013
To amend the Internal Revenue Code of 1986 to extend for 1 year the exclusion from gross income of discharges of qualified principal residence indebtedness.
Mortgage Forgiveness Tax Relief Act of 2013

latestAction.text: Referred to the House Committee on Ways and Means.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
